Message.Title: When does BAC payout ratio improve? Div way too low for far too long!
Message.Msg: IMHO BAC has plenty of cash to lend more and pay greater dividends. Perhaps that will be the motivation for the next upturn in the stock price. Thoughts?

Topic.Title: When does BAC payout ratio improve? Div way too low for far too long!

Message.Msg: The amount of cash they have isn't what determines dividends. It's the amount of earnings and capital. Dividends are a return of capital generally paid out of current or retained earnings. With capital rules being changed and the possibility of the big banks having to further increase equity based capital, I wouldn't expect to see any rapid increases in dividends any time soon as they will be keeping earnings to bring up their capital ratios to satisfy regulators.

Topic.Title: When does BAC payout ratio improve? Div way too low for far too long!

Message.Msg: Increasing loans are a similar situation. Banks are required to set aside a certain amount of reserves and capital for every dollar of loans they make. This is part of what determines leverage. At the moment, regulators are forcing banks to reduce leverage which is done by requiring them to keep more reserves and capital for every dollar they loan. Thus, less money to loan.

Topic.Title: When does BAC payout ratio improve? Div way too low for far too long!

Message.Msg: There have been too many PR disasters on Moynihan's watch - he must be replaced immediately. First, they increased fees and had to roll back when customers loudly complained, negatively affecting image of the bank. Then they forced city to sue a customer who wrote in chalk a derogatory remark about dishonest bank and the customer got acquitted by jury. Then BAC gets sued on the ground t hat employees were rewarded for scuttling the settlement terms on mortgage modification. There have been just too many missteps that severely hurt bank's image and reputation. The banking business thrives on honesty and trust, bu t BAC is so poor managed with bad culture that a new CEO is needed to clean the house. Until that's done, BAC stock will suffer.

Message.Msg: Russian Population 1917 184,600,000 1926 147,000,000 The Judeo-Bolshevik Murder Spree Of course, Stalin's real purpose was the extermination of the Christian anti-Communist population within the USSR. We now know that the phrase "breaking the resistance of the peasants" turned out to be a political euphemism to conceal Stalin's true intentions of mass murder. The conservative estimate for the number of deaths by starvation under Stalin's reign is 10,000,000 Ukrainians, as reported by the Encyclopedia Britannica. Yet, other sources show the numbers to be much higher. Taking into account the full toll of Communism on the Russian people, the number reaches 45,000,000. At the Royal Albert Hall in London, on October 31, 1967, the numbers were presented as follows (let us remember that we are talking fundamentally about white (which means anti-Communist, not racial, people): Russia's Population Was 174 Million In 1914, And 147 Million In 1926 HERE ARE THE DEAD A. Russian Revolution and Civil War - 1,500,000 B. Civilian deaths in the Civil War and Ensuing Famine - 13,000,000 C. Murders of "class enemies" - 3,000,000 D. 1933 Famine caused by disaster of first Five Year Plan (installation of collectivism) - 7,000,000 E. Stalinist purges - 1,500,000 F. Topic.Title: DOW is green and yet BAC is red ... What a POS!!!

Message.Msg: Too many lawsuits, too much hanging over the company at every turn. Every time something is resolved for the company, another lawsuit springs up. Throw in a few judges that have an axe to grind and investors run for the hills over the uncertainty. If every time BofA settles a suit and there's going to be an appeal or it's taken to a higher court..this could go on for years. Meanwhile, my Ford is selling cars like crazy, hitting 52 week highs and my mindset is to just switch it out. I'm not going to sit around waiting for a judge to decide the fate for the share price, whuich is exactly what is happening right now.

Topic.Title: BAC is the weakest bank on among banks on wallstreet - DD

Message.Msg: Not sure about declaring bankruptcy but they are no doubt weak based upon stock price performance this year. Peer prices have taken off while BAC just sits there and spins its wheels. Very frustrating to hold this stock. But wait, they do pay a tiny dividend. Guess that makes everything fine. NOT!!!

Topic.Title: This POS ain't going nowhere

Message.Msg: Too many lawsuits overhanging and everytime something is resolved a new lawsuit springs up. The stock is being held hostage by an endless supply of lawsuits and now one single judge is going to decide the fate of an 8 billion dollar settlement. If she says no, what then? The stock will get hammered. Why am I going to wait around for that uncertainty when my Ford is going like gangbusters will no sign of slowing. I like BofA because of the potential but if I'm going to be hamstrung because everytime they move forward another lawsuit pops up...why bother. There are better ways to utilize your investment money. I'm tired of the endless parade of lawsuits quite frankly. I'm not assessing blame or deflecting it but the mere fact that lawsuit after lawsuit is being filed seems to be wearing on shareholders and they are selling. I'm getting there.

Message.Title: The Truth About Lockerbie
Message.Msg: The Assassination Of A Mossad Double Agent Who Was Connected To Lockerbie Billionaire Ashraf Marwan Falls Off A Six Story Balcony. The Lockerbie Case Explodes In Israel's face Marwan Was Said To Be Involved. The Main Lockerbie Defendant Is Released Ashraf Marwan Falls Off A Highrise The Same Day. A Lot Of Coincidences The timing, and colorful departure, of Ashraf Marwan, mimics his life. Starting as a third-rate Egyptian officer, he woos Nassar's daughter and starts his climb to power. He quickly sells out to Israel, tipping off the Israelis about the start of the Yom Kippur war in 1973. He served in Egyptian Intelligence, and alerted Israel to most of the Arab strategy during the 1973 war. If he did that, then God knows what else he was involved in. An Agent Is Used To Send A Message Marwarn was suspected in the Lockerbie cover-up, and his assassination sends a message. Assassinated On May 28. 2007 That is the day the Lockerbie trial verdict was tossed, called a 'Miscarriage of Justice', and the case was re-opened. Lockerbie Trial Hoax Israel, backed by Zionists in the US blamed the Lockerbie bombing on Gaddafi, Libya, and these two Arabs. Almost Twenty Years Later The trial, considered to be a Zionist Flim Flam, blows up, and the Arab is released. The Trial Was In The Netherlands The Netherlands is totally controlled by Zionists. Their diamond trade, ecstasy, slave running, cocaine distribution , etc. is based here. Al-Megrahi Gets New Trial Abdelbaset Ali Mohmed Al-Megrahi, who is in a Scottish prison, welcomed the decision by the independent Scottish Criminal Cases Review Commission (SCCRC), which found he "may have suffered a miscarriage of justice" at his 2001 trial. Famed Mossad Informant Slips Ashraf Marwan fell off his six story balcony Gaddafi Is Not Surprised Meanwhile in Tripoli, Libya Colonel Gaddafi said he wasn't really surprised because his best guess was that Marwan was the turncoat Mossad #$%$ who had framed the Libyan Al-Megrahi for the Lockerbie bombing. Mossad Sends A Message Normally when they publicly execute someone, the point is to send a message. I sort of doubt anyone will be anxious to come forward on Israeli involvement in Lockerbie. This Follows The Entebbe Revelations On 6/10/2007, the British secret service accidentally released their confidential files which revealed that it was Israel's Mossad, working with Abu Nidal, and the PLO, that staged Entebbe. Court Says Evidence Planted The key evidence was a circuit board the size of a fingernail, and the court says it was planted. So now the question is: - "If Megrahi didn’t carry out Lockerbie, who did?" Zionists Live By Their Self-Made Mystique They peppered the Bible with fables of Abraham, lost tribes, Solomon's Temple, Masada, Samson, etc. Now, move to the Twentieth Century and 21st Century, and you have the Freuds, Einsteins, Chess Champions, 135 average IQ, the Holocaust, Dell computer, their business wizards, etc. But what happens when the world stops believing 4,000,000 Auschwitz Jews died in a two-car garage from bug spray? What if people talked about the 50 million killed by Bolsheviks? I dare say between the internet, the 9/11 questions, the ability to review historical events, etc, that now is not a good time for Lockerbie to be blamed on the Mossad.

Topic.Title: Replace Moynihan with someone better judgement and PR sensitivities - BAC needs better culture

Message.Msg: I also blame Board of Directors that is ignoring all these missteps and not doing anything to change the culture. I also blame the media that is not asking tough questions and demand some answers. I also blame big investors (pension funds, hedge funds) that are not demanding that Moynihan respond to shareholders' concerns. Finally, I blame customers of BAC who have not closed their accounts or tear-off their BAC credit cards or avoid buying other BAC products. If everyone collectively take actions, there is no way Moynihan and BoD will not listen - right now they think that they can do all this and get away with it and there is no appreciable cost. Shareholders demand accountability.
